revised_title: The Difference Between Ice Made Without Air and Ice Made in Air
tldr: Carolo Rinaldini conducts experiments to demonstrate the differences between ice formed without air and ice formed in the presence of air. He finds that ice formed without air is opaque and whitish, similar to hail, while ice formed in the air is transparent like crystal. Additionally, he observes that ice formed without air is denser than ice formed in the air.
